intro: Millotia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy millotia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Millotia pilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
